Instruction: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly grease the baking sheets.
Mix softened butter, sugar, and eggs together until smooth and creamy.
Mix nuts and flour in a separate bowl and combine with creamed mixture.

Roll out the dough in batches on a lightly floured surface to about 1/16 inch thickness. Use a 1-inch star-shaped cookie cutter to cut out shapes. Place the cookies on the prepared baking sheets and brush the tops with the remaining beaten egg white.
Bake in the preheated oven for 6 to 8 minutes at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Add food coloring to the egg white for brushing the cookie tops as desired. Create snowflake cookies by sandwiching two cookies together with confectioners' sugar icing made of confectioners' sugar, vanilla, and cream.
